intro: Adenosma triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered adenosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and usually have five petals. Adenosma triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
